greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of trees with n bicolored nodes and f nodes of the first color. Triangle T(n,f) read by rows, 0<=f<=n.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1274
formula: T(n,f) = T(n,n-f), flipping all node colors.
program: R(n, y)={my(v=vector(n)); v[1]=1; for(k=1, n-1, my(p=(1+y)*v[k]); my(q=Vec(prod(j=0, poldegree(p,y), (1/(1-x*y^j) + O(x*x^(n\k)))^polcoeff(p,j)))); v=vector(n, j, v[j] + sum(i=1, (j-1)\k, v[j-i*k] * q[i+1]))); v;}
{ my(A=M(10)); for(n=0, #A-1, print(Vecrev(polcoeff(A, n)))) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, May 12 2018
xref: Cf. A038056 (row sums), A000055 (diagonal and 1st column), A000081 (subdiagonal and 2nd column), A303833 (3rd column), A303843 (4th column), A304311 (connected graphs), A304489 (rooted).
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 16 2018
